content:
I have PRed a proof of the Iwasawa criterion using primitive actions in #12048

To try to make things reasonable, there are several PRs that lead to that one.

  • #12023 : Generalization of image_smul_set etc. lemmas that hold for equivariant maps
  • #12049 : Blocks
  • #12050 : Blocks (continued) — Order isomorphism between blocks containing a point and subgroups containing the stabilizer of that point
  • #12051 : Blocks (continued) — Results that hold for actions on finite sets
  • #12052 : Primitive actions
  • #12053 : Primitive action (continued) — Results that hold for actions on finite sets. Theorem of Rubio

The next steps will be a proof of Jordan's theorem that a primitive subgroup of the symmetric group that contains a cycle contains the alternating group, the description of some maximal subgroups of the alternating group, culminating in a complicated proof of the simplicity of the alternating group.
@Antoine Chambert-Loir Thanks so much for these PRs! I just left a review on the top PR. Some nitpicks about formatting comments and section/variables. But otherwise, LGTM.
Thanks @Johan Commelin ! I did the requested changes andborsed r+.
